Title: Genetic Improvement of Genetic Programming
Source: IEEE Congr. Evol. Comput., CEC - Conf. Proc.
Abstract: © 2020 IEEE.GISMOE BNF grammar based GI is applied to optimise run time of the tree interpreter in the fastest single computer floating point genetic programming system, GPavx. Up to two fold speed up is obtained. Performance varies with tree size. The GI version of Singleton's C++ GPquick is demonstrated on random trees of up to 79 million opcodes on Intel AVX512 SIMD parallel compute servers.
AuthorKeywords: Advanced Vector eXtensions (AVX) Single Instruction Multiple Data (SIMD)
